subtitle: hi I'm Simon Jacobsen welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question for this
week is the educational system my
daughter is very creative and she's
having a hard time with going to school
we're thinking about homeschooling her
does homeschooling create social
problems for children very good question
I don't think we could have one blanket
answer for that one size fits all it has
a lot to do with the child has a lot to
do who the tutoring and I was a lot to
do with the parents I think a healthy
child development requires a number of
things one of them is definitely having
friends so to just tutor and homeschool
someone without any friends would that
be wise but there are many ways that one
can have a social life even when they're
being homeschooled I really think it
comes down to weighing the pros and cons
on the other hand having a child that's
very creative and being forced to
conform to the standards of let's say an
average class and we let's face it most
schools their resources only allow for
dealing more or less with the average
student not with excellent not with the
very poor students so having a creative
student have an outlet there are several
solutions maybe it's not home schooling
maybe it's getting a tutor and out of
school hours or even getting the
school's permission to do some extra
work for this child to develop and to
challenge and to elicit that creativity
homeschooling is always an option but to
make sure that the child doesn't start
growing up feeling different even if
they're brilliant because you want them
to also have the ability to have
friendship and social skills as well as
just the basic education that we learn
from being with others and not just
being isolated geniuses I have seen
homeschooling work in a very great way
of satisfying those needs I've also seen
it been done through supplemental
education
without taking this child out of school
if you cannot find the social circle for
the child to naturally be in because
remember then the day when you finish
school and your front with your friends
that went to school it works well to
impose it and superimposing or unnatural
way is also not that good so if you
can't really find a social natural
social circle a natural social support
for your child I would be very cautious
of entering into a homeschooling
situation just to satisfy the creative
needs of this child due to the loss of
having that type of friendship and
socialization so it's really a
combination of many factors has to be
weighed case-by-case and seeing what's
the best possible solution under the
circumstances but I do commend parents
that ask this question because you're
thinking about it you're not just taken
for granted and is very important to pay
attention because that's when we come up
with the best solutions so I would look
at all the options weigh the pros and
cons and then resolve it in that fashion
thank you for watching I welcome your
personal questions have a meaningful
week
you
